intro: Trisetaria parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered trisetaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is a perennial herb native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the leaves are narrow and grass-like. Trisetaria parviflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
